# (git 1) Genotyping I (SNPs only)

This pipeline can be executed as follows:

```sh
cd $BASE_DIR/nf/01_genotyping
source ../sh/nextflow_alias.sh
nf_run_gatk
```

## Summary

The genotyping procedure is controlled by the [**nextflow**](https://www.nextflow.io/) script `genotyping.nf` (located under `$BASE_DIR/nf/01_genotyping/`).
It takes the analysis from the raw sequencing data to the genotyped and phased SNPs.
Below is an overview of the steps involved in the genotyping process.
(The <span style="color:#4DAF4A">green dot</span> indicates the raw data input, <span style="color:#E41A1C">red arrows</span> depict output that is exported for further use.)

<div style="max-width:800px; margin:auto;">

## Details of `genotyping.nf`

### Data preparation

The nextflow script starts with a small header and then opens the analysis by reading a table with meta data about the samples.
The table is parsed and the values are stored in nextflow variables.

<div class="kclass">

<div class="sourceCode">
<pre class="sourceCode">
<code class="sourceCode">#<span class="hl opt">!/</span>usr<span class="hl opt">/</span>bin<span class="hl opt">/</span>env nextflow
<span class="hl com">/* ===============================================================</span>
<span class="hl com">   Disclaimer: This pipeline needs a lot of time &amp; memory to run:</span>
<span class="hl com">   All in all we used roughly 10 TB and ran for about 1 Month</span>
<span class="hl com">	 (mainly due to limited bandwidth on the cluster durint the</span>
<span class="hl com">	 &quot;receive_tuple step)</span>
<span class="hl com">	 ===============================================================</span>
<span class="hl com">*/</span>

<span class="hl slc">// git 1.1</span>
<span class="hl com">/* open the pipeline based on the metadata spread sheet that includes all</span>
<span class="hl com"> information necessary to assign read groups to the sequencing data,</span>
<span class="hl com"> split the spread sheet by row and feed it into a channel */</span>
<span class="hl kwa">Channel</span>
	.fromPath<span class="hl opt">(</span><span class="hl str">&#39;../../metadata/file_info.txt&#39;</span><span class="hl opt">)</span>
	.splitCsv<span class="hl opt">(</span>header<span class="hl opt">:</span>true<span class="hl opt">,</span> sep<span class="hl opt">:</span><span class="hl str">&quot;</span><span class="hl esc">\t</span><span class="hl str">&quot;</span><span class="hl opt">)</span>
	.map<span class="hl opt">{</span> row <span class="hl opt">-&gt; [</span> id<span class="hl opt">:</span>row.id<span class="hl opt">,</span> <span class="hl kwb">label</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>row.label<span class="hl opt">,</span> file_fwd<span class="hl opt">:</span>row.file_fwd<span class="hl opt">,</span> file_rev<span class="hl opt">:</span>row.file_rev<span class="hl opt">,</span> flowcell_id_fwd<span class="hl opt">:</span>row.flowcell_id_fwd<span class="hl opt">,</span> lane_fwd<span class="hl opt">:</span>row.lane_fwd<span class="hl opt">,</span> company<span class="hl opt">:</span>row.company<span class="hl opt">] }</span>
	.set <span class="hl opt">{</span> samples_ch <span class="hl opt">}</span>
</code>
</pre>
</div>
</div>

The first step to prepare the data for the [GATK best practices](https://gatkforums.broadinstitute.org/gatk/discussion/6483/how-to-map-and-clean-up-short-read-sequence-data-efficiently), is to convert the sample sequences from `*.fq` to `*.bam` format to assign read groups:

<div class="kclass">

<div class="sourceCode">
<pre class="sourceCode">
<code class="sourceCode"><span class="hl slc">// git 1.2</span>
<span class="hl com">/* for every sequencing file, convert into ubam format and assign read groups */</span>
<span class="hl kwa">process</span> split_samples <span class="hl opt">{</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">label</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;L_20g2h_split_samples&#39;</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">input</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwc">val</span> x <span class="hl kwa">from</span> samples_ch

	<span class="hl kwb">output</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> <span class="hl kwc">val</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;</span><span class="hl ipl">${x.label}</span><span class="hl str">.</span><span class="hl ipl">${x.lane_fwd}</span><span class="hl str">&quot;</span> <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;</span><span class="hl ipl">${x.label}</span><span class="hl str">.</span><span class="hl ipl">${x.lane_fwd}</span><span class="hl str">.ubam.bam&quot;</span> <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">into</span> ubams_mark<span class="hl opt">,</span> ubams_merge

	<span class="hl kwb">script</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl str">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl str">	echo -e &quot;---------------------------------&quot;</span>
<span class="hl str">	echo -e &quot;Label:</span><span class="hl esc">\t\t</span><span class="hl str"></span><span class="hl ipl">${x.label}</span><span class="hl str"></span><span class="hl esc">\n</span><span class="hl str">Fwd:</span><span class="hl esc">\t\t</span><span class="hl str"></span><span class="hl ipl">${x.file_fwd}</span><span class="hl str"></span><span class="hl esc">\n</span><span class="hl str">Rev:</span><span class="hl esc">\t\t</span><span class="hl str"></span><span class="hl ipl">${x.file_rev}</span><span class="hl str">&quot;</span>
<span class="hl str">	echo -e &quot;Flowcell:</span><span class="hl esc">\t</span><span class="hl str"></span><span class="hl ipl">${x.flowcell_id_fwd}</span><span class="hl str"></span><span class="hl esc">\n</span><span class="hl str">Lane:</span><span class="hl esc">\t\t</span><span class="hl str"></span><span class="hl ipl">${x.lane_fwd}</span><span class="hl str">&quot;</span>
<span class="hl str">	echo -e &quot;Read group:</span><span class="hl esc">\t</span><span class="hl str"></span><span class="hl ipl">${x.flowcell_id_fwd}</span><span class="hl str">.</span><span class="hl ipl">${x.lane_fwd}</span><span class="hl str"></span><span class="hl esc">\n</span><span class="hl str">Company:</span><span class="hl esc">\t</span><span class="hl str"></span><span class="hl ipl">${x.company}</span><span class="hl str">&quot;</span>
<span class="hl str"></span>
<span class="hl str">	mkdir -p \$BASE_DIR/temp_files</span>
<span class="hl str"></span>
<span class="hl str">	gatk --java-options &quot;-Xmx20G&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		FastqToSam \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-SM=</span><span class="hl ipl">${x.label}</span> <span class="hl str">\</span>
<span class="hl str">		-F1=\$BASE_DIR/data/seqdata/</span><span class="hl ipl">${x.file_fwd}</span> <span class="hl str">\</span>
<span class="hl str">		-F2=\$BASE_DIR/data/seqdata/</span><span class="hl ipl">${x.file_rev}</span> <span class="hl str">\</span>
<span class="hl str">		-O=</span><span class="hl ipl">${x.label}</span><span class="hl str">.</span><span class="hl ipl">${x.lane_fwd}</span><span class="hl str">.ubam.bam \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-RG=</span><span class="hl ipl">${x.label}</span><span class="hl str">.</span><span class="hl ipl">${x.lane_fwd}</span> <span class="hl str">\</span>
<span class="hl str">		-LB=</span><span class="hl ipl">${x.label}</span><span class="hl str">&quot;.lib1&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-PU=</span><span class="hl ipl">${x.flowcell_id_fwd}</span><span class="hl str">.</span><span class="hl ipl">${x.lane_fwd}</span> <span class="hl str">\</span>
<span class="hl str">		-PL=Illumina \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-CN=</span><span class="hl ipl">${x.company}</span> <span class="hl str">\</span>
<span class="hl str">		--TMP_DIR=\$BASE_DIR/temp_files;</span>
<span class="hl str">	&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl opt">}</span>
</code>
</pre>
</div>
</div>

The second step is marking the *Illumina* adapters.

<div class="kclass">

<div class="sourceCode">
<pre class="sourceCode">
<code class="sourceCode"><span class="hl slc">// git 1.3</span>
<span class="hl com">/* for every ubam file, mark Illumina adapters */</span>
<span class="hl kwa">process</span> mark_adapters <span class="hl opt">{</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">label</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;L_20g2h_mark_adapters&#39;</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">tag</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;</span><span class="hl ipl">${sample}</span><span class="hl str">&quot;</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">input</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> <span class="hl kwc">val</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> sample <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl kwb">input</span> <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">from</span> ubams_mark

	<span class="hl kwb">output</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> <span class="hl kwc">val</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> sample <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;*.adapter.bam&quot;</span><span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">into</span> adapter_bams
	<span class="hl kwc">file</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;*.adapter.metrics.txt&quot;</span> <span class="hl kwa">into</span> adapter_metrics

	<span class="hl kwb">script</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl str">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl str">	gatk --java-options &quot;-Xmx18G&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		MarkIlluminaAdapters \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-I=</span><span class="hl ipl">${input}</span> <span class="hl str">\</span>
<span class="hl str">		-O=</span><span class="hl ipl">${sample}</span><span class="hl str">.adapter.bam \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-M=</span><span class="hl ipl">${sample}</span><span class="hl str">.adapter.metrics.txt \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-TMP_DIR=\$BASE_DIR/temp_files;</span>
<span class="hl str">	&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl opt">}</span>
</code>
</pre>
</div>
</div>

We need to pass on the unaligned `.bam` file and the file containing the adapter information together, so the output of the first two processes are matched by the combined sample and sequencing lane information.

<div class="kclass">

<div class="sourceCode">
<pre class="sourceCode">
<code class="sourceCode"><span class="hl slc">// git 1.4</span>
adapter_bams
	.combine<span class="hl opt">(</span>ubams_merge<span class="hl opt">,</span> by<span class="hl opt">:</span><span class="hl num">0</span><span class="hl opt">)</span>
	.set <span class="hl opt">{</span>merge_input<span class="hl opt">}</span>
</code>
</pre>
</div>
</div>

For the actual mapping, the sequences are transformed back into `.fq` format, aligned using `bwa` and merged back with their original read group information.

<div class="kclass">

<div class="sourceCode">
<pre class="sourceCode">
<code class="sourceCode"><span class="hl slc">// git 1.5</span>
<span class="hl com">/* this step includes a 3 step pipeline:</span>
<span class="hl com">*  - re-transformatikon into fq format</span>
<span class="hl com">*  - mapping aginst the reference genome_file</span>
<span class="hl com">*  - merging with the basuch ubams to include</span>
<span class="hl com">		read group information */</span>
<span class="hl kwa">process</span> map_and_merge <span class="hl opt">{</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">label</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;L_75g24h8t_map_and_merge&#39;</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">tag</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;</span><span class="hl ipl">${sample}</span><span class="hl str">&quot;</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">input</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> <span class="hl kwc">val</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> sample <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> adapter_bam_input <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> ubam_input <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">from</span> merge_input

	<span class="hl kwb">output</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> <span class="hl kwc">val</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> sample <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;*.mapped.bam&quot;</span> <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">into</span> mapped_bams

	<span class="hl kwb">script</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl str">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl str">	set -o pipefail</span>
<span class="hl str">	gatk --java-options &quot;-Xmx68G&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		SamToFastq \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-I=</span><span class="hl ipl">${adapter_bam_input}</span> <span class="hl str">\</span>
<span class="hl str">		-FASTQ=/dev/stdout \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-INTERLEAVE=true \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-NON_PF=true \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-TMP_DIR=\$BASE_DIR/temp_files | \</span>
<span class="hl str">	bwa mem -M -t 8 -p \$BASE_DIR/ressources/HP_genome_unmasked_01.fa /dev/stdin |</span>
<span class="hl str">	gatk --java-options &quot;-Xmx68G&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		MergeBamAlignment \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--VALIDATION_STRINGENCY SILENT \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--EXPECTED_ORIENTATIONS FR \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--ATTRIBUTES_TO_RETAIN X0 \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-ALIGNED_BAM=/dev/stdin \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-UNMAPPED_BAM=</span><span class="hl ipl">${ubam_input}</span> <span class="hl str">\</span>
<span class="hl str">		-OUTPUT=</span><span class="hl ipl">${sample}</span><span class="hl str">.mapped.bam \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--REFERENCE_SEQUENCE=\$BASE_DIR/ressources/HP_genome_unmasked_01.fa.gz \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-PAIRED_RUN true \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--SORT_ORDER &quot;unsorted&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--IS_BISULFITE_SEQUENCE false \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--ALIGNED_READS_ONLY false \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--CLIP_ADAPTERS false \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM 2000000 \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--ADD_MATE_CIGAR true \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--MAX_INSERTIONS_OR_DELETIONS -1 \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--PRIMARY_ALIGNMENT_STRATEGY MostDistant \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--UNMAPPED_READ_STRATEGY COPY_TO_TAG \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--ALIGNER_PROPER_PAIR_FLAGS true \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--UNMAP_CONTAMINANT_READS true \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-TMP_DIR=\$BASE_DIR/temp_files</span>
<span class="hl str">	&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl opt">}</span>
</code>
</pre>
</div>
</div>

Next, the duplicates are being marked.

<div class="kclass">

<div class="sourceCode">
<pre class="sourceCode">
<code class="sourceCode"><span class="hl slc">// git 1.6</span>
<span class="hl com">/* for every mapped sample,sort and mark duplicates</span>
<span class="hl com">* (intermediate step is required to create .bai file) */</span>
<span class="hl kwa">process</span> mark_duplicates <span class="hl opt">{</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">label</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;L_32g30h_mark_duplicates&#39;</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">publishDir</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;../../1_genotyping/0_sorted_bams/&quot;</span><span class="hl opt">,</span> mode<span class="hl opt">:</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;symlink&#39;</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">tag</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;</span><span class="hl ipl">${sample}</span><span class="hl str">&quot;</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">input</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> <span class="hl kwc">val</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> sample <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl kwb">input</span> <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">from</span> mapped_bams

	<span class="hl kwb">output</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> <span class="hl kwc">val</span> <span class="hl opt">{</span> sample  <span class="hl opt">- ~/</span>\.<span class="hl opt">(</span>\d<span class="hl opt">+)/ },</span> <span class="hl kwc">val</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> sample <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;*.dedup.bam&quot;</span><span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">into</span> dedup_bams
	<span class="hl kwc">file</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;*.dedup.metrics.txt&quot;</span> <span class="hl kwa">into</span> dedup_metrics

	<span class="hl kwb">script</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl str">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl str">	set -o pipefail</span>
<span class="hl str">	gatk --java-options &quot;-Xmx30G&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		SortSam \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-I=</span><span class="hl ipl">${input}</span> <span class="hl str">\</span>
<span class="hl str">		-O=/dev/stdout \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--SORT_ORDER=&quot;coordinate&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--CREATE_INDEX=false \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--CREATE_MD5_FILE=false \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-TMP_DIR=\$BASE_DIR/temp_files \</span>
<span class="hl str">		| \</span>
<span class="hl str">	gatk --java-options &quot;-Xmx30G&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		SetNmAndUqTags \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--INPUT=/dev/stdin \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--OUTPUT=intermediate.bam \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--CREATE_INDEX=true \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--CREATE_MD5_FILE=true \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-TMP_DIR=\$BASE_DIR/temp_files \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--REFERENCE_SEQUENCE=\$BASE_DIR/ressources/HP_genome_unmasked_01.fa.gz</span>
<span class="hl str"></span>
<span class="hl str">	gatk --java-options &quot;-Xmx30G&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		MarkDuplicates \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-I=intermediate.bam \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-O=</span><span class="hl ipl">${sample}</span><span class="hl str">.dedup.bam \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-M=</span><span class="hl ipl">${sample}</span><span class="hl str">.dedup.metrics.txt \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-MAX_FILE_HANDLES=1000  \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-TMP_DIR=\$BASE_DIR/temp_files</span>
<span class="hl str"></span>
<span class="hl str">	rm intermediate*</span>
<span class="hl str">	&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl opt">}</span>
</code>
</pre>
</div>
</div>

As a preparation for the actual genotyping, the `.bam` files are being indexed.

<div class="kclass">

<div class="sourceCode">
<pre class="sourceCode">
<code class="sourceCode"><span class="hl slc">// git 1.7</span>
<span class="hl com">/* index al bam files */</span>
<span class="hl kwa">process</span> index_bam <span class="hl opt">{</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">label</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;L_32g1h_index_bam&#39;</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">tag</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;</span><span class="hl ipl">${sample}</span><span class="hl str">&quot;</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">input</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> <span class="hl kwc">val</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> sample <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">val</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> sample_lane <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl kwb">input</span> <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">from</span> dedup_bams

	<span class="hl kwb">output</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> <span class="hl kwc">val</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> sample <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">val</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> sample_lane <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl kwb">input</span> <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;*.bai&quot;</span><span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">into</span> <span class="hl opt">(</span> indexed_bams<span class="hl opt">,</span> pir_bams <span class="hl opt">)</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">script</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl str">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl str">	gatk --java-options &quot;-Xmx30G&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		BuildBamIndex \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-INPUT=</span><span class="hl ipl">${input}</span>
<span class="hl str">	&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl opt">}</span>
</code>
</pre>
</div>
</div>

At this point the preparation of the sequencing is done and we can start with the genotyping.
(The output of the data preparation is split and one copy is later also used to prepare the read aware phasing in the process called [extractPirs](#phasing_start).)

### Genotying

Since some of our samples were split over several lanes, we now need to collect all `.bam` files for each sample.

<div class="kclass">

<div class="sourceCode">
<pre class="sourceCode">
<code class="sourceCode"><span class="hl slc">// git 1.8</span>
<span class="hl com">/* collect all bam files for each sample */</span>
indexed_bams
	.groupTuple<span class="hl opt">()</span>
	.set <span class="hl opt">{</span>tubbled<span class="hl opt">}</span>
</code>
</pre>
</div>
</div>

Now, we can create the genotype likelihoods for each individual sample.

<div class="kclass">

<div class="sourceCode">
<pre class="sourceCode">
<code class="sourceCode"><span class="hl slc">// git 1.9</span>
<span class="hl com">/* create one *.g.vcf file per sample */</span>
<span class="hl kwa">process</span> receive_tuple <span class="hl opt">{</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">label</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;L_36g47h_receive_tuple&#39;</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">publishDir</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;../../1_genotyping/1_gvcfs/&quot;</span><span class="hl opt">,</span> mode<span class="hl opt">:</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;symlink&#39;</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">tag</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;</span><span class="hl ipl">${sample}</span><span class="hl str">&quot;</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">input</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> sample<span class="hl opt">,</span> sample_lane<span class="hl opt">,</span> bam<span class="hl opt">,</span> bai <span class="hl kwa">from</span> tubbled

	<span class="hl kwb">output</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;*.g.vcf.gz&quot;</span><span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">into</span> gvcfs
	<span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;*.vcf.gz.tbi&quot;</span><span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">into</span> tbis

	<span class="hl kwb">script</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl str">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl str">	INPUT=\$(echo</span> <span class="hl ipl">${bam}</span>  <span class="hl str">| sed  &#39;s/</span><span class="hl esc">\\</span><span class="hl str">[/-I /g; s/</span><span class="hl esc">\\</span><span class="hl str">]//g; s/,/ -I/g&#39;)</span>
<span class="hl str"></span>
<span class="hl str">	gatk --java-options &quot;-Xmx35g&quot; HaplotypeCaller  \</span>
<span class="hl str">	  -R=\$BASE_DIR/ressources/HP_genome_unmasked_01.fa \</span>
<span class="hl str">	  \$INPUT \</span>
<span class="hl str">	  -O</span> <span class="hl ipl">${sample}</span><span class="hl str">.g.vcf.gz \</span>
<span class="hl str">	  -ERC GVCF</span>
<span class="hl str">	&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl opt">}</span>
</code>
</pre>
</div>
</div>

The individual genotype likelihoods are collected and combined for the entire data set.

<div class="kclass">

<div class="sourceCode">
<pre class="sourceCode">
<code class="sourceCode"><span class="hl slc">// git 1.10</span>
<span class="hl com">/* collect and combine all *.g.vcf files */</span>
<span class="hl kwa">process</span> gather_gvcfs <span class="hl opt">{</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">label</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;L_O88g90h_gather_gvcfs&#39;</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">publishDir</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;../../1_genotyping/1_gvcfs/&quot;</span><span class="hl opt">,</span> mode<span class="hl opt">:</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;symlink&#39;</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">echo</span> true

	<span class="hl kwb">input</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> gvcf <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">from</span> gvcfs.collect<span class="hl opt">()</span>
	<span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> tbi <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">from</span> tbis.collect<span class="hl opt">()</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">output</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;cohort.g.vcf.gz&quot;</span> <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;cohort.g.vcf.gz.tbi&quot;</span> <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">into</span> <span class="hl opt">(</span> gcvf_snps<span class="hl opt">,</span> gvcf_acs<span class="hl opt">,</span> gvcf_indel <span class="hl opt">)</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">script</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl str">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl str">	GVCF=\$(echo &quot;</span> <span class="hl ipl">${gvcf}</span><span class="hl str">&quot; | sed &#39;s/ /-V /g; s/vcf.gz/vcf.gz /g&#39;)</span>
<span class="hl str"></span>
<span class="hl str">	gatk --java-options &quot;-Xmx85g&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		CombineGVCFs \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-R=\$BASE_DIR/ressources/HP_genome_unmasked_01.fa \</span>
<span class="hl str">		\$GVCF \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-O cohort.g.vcf.gz</span>
<span class="hl str">	&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl opt">}</span>
</code>
</pre>
</div>
</div>

All samples are jointly genotyped.

<div class="kclass">

<div class="sourceCode">
<pre class="sourceCode">
<code class="sourceCode"><span class="hl slc">// git 1.11</span>
<span class="hl com">/* actual genotyping step (varinat sites only) */</span>
<span class="hl kwa">process</span> joint_genotype_snps <span class="hl opt">{</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">label</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;L_O88g90h_joint_genotype&#39;</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">publishDir</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;../../1_genotyping/2_raw_vcfs/&quot;</span><span class="hl opt">,</span> mode<span class="hl opt">:</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;symlink&#39;</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">input</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> vcf <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> tbi <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">from</span> gcvf_snps

	<span class="hl kwb">output</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;raw_var_sites.vcf.gz&quot;</span> <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;raw_var_sites.vcf.gz.tbi&quot;</span> <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">into</span> <span class="hl opt">(</span> raw_var_sites<span class="hl opt">,</span> raw_var_sites_to_metrics <span class="hl opt">)</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">script</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl str">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl str">	gatk --java-options &quot;-Xmx85g&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		GenotypeGVCFs \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-R=\$BASE_DIR/ressources/HP_genome_unmasked_01.fa \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-V=</span><span class="hl ipl">${vcf}</span> <span class="hl str">\</span>
<span class="hl str">		-O=intermediate.vcf.gz</span>
<span class="hl str"></span>
<span class="hl str">	gatk --java-options &quot;-Xmx85G&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		SelectVariants \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-R=\$BASE_DIR/ressources/HP_genome_unmasked_01.fa \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-V=intermediate.vcf.gz \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--select-type-to-include=SNP \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-O=raw_var_sites.vcf.gz</span>
<span class="hl str"></span>
<span class="hl str">	rm intermediate.*</span>
<span class="hl str">	&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl opt">}</span>
</code>
</pre>
</div>
</div>

The output of this process is split and used to collect the genotype metrics to inform the [hard filtering of SNPs](https://gatkforums.broadinstitute.org/gatk/discussion/2806/howto-apply-hard-filters-to-a-call-set) and to pass on the genotypes to the process called [filterSNPs](#filterSNPS).

At this point we create a channel containing all 24 hamlet linkage groups (LGs).
This is used later (in the process called [extractPirs](#phasing_start)) since all LGs are phased separately and only located at this part of the script for historical reasons (sorry :/).

<div class="kclass">

<div class="sourceCode">
<pre class="sourceCode">
<code class="sourceCode"><span class="hl slc">// git 1.12</span>
<span class="hl com">/* generate a LG channel */</span>
<span class="hl kwa">Channel</span>
	.from<span class="hl opt">( (</span><span class="hl str">&#39;01&#39;</span>..<span class="hl str">&#39;09&#39;</span><span class="hl opt">) + (</span><span class="hl str">&#39;10&#39;</span>..<span class="hl str">&#39;19&#39;</span><span class="hl opt">) + (</span><span class="hl str">&#39;20&#39;</span>..<span class="hl str">&#39;24&#39;</span><span class="hl opt">) )</span>
	.into<span class="hl opt">{</span> LG_ids1<span class="hl opt">;</span> LG_ids2 <span class="hl opt">}</span>
</code>
</pre>
</div>
</div>

The metrics of the raw genotypes are collected.

<div class="kclass">

<div class="sourceCode">
<pre class="sourceCode">
<code class="sourceCode"><span class="hl slc">// git 1.13</span>
<span class="hl com">/* produce metrics table to determine filtering thresholds - ups forgot to extract SNPS first*/</span>
<span class="hl kwa">process</span> joint_genotype_metrics <span class="hl opt">{</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">label</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;L_28g5h_genotype_metrics&#39;</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">publishDir</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;../../1_genotyping/2_raw_vcfs/&quot;</span><span class="hl opt">,</span> mode<span class="hl opt">:</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;move&#39;</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">input</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> vcf <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> tbi <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">from</span> raw_var_sites_to_metrics

	<span class="hl kwb">output</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;</span><span class="hl ipl">${vcf}</span><span class="hl str">.table.txt&quot;</span> <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">into</span> raw_metrics

	<span class="hl kwb">script</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl str">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl str">	gatk --java-options &quot;-Xmx25G&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		VariantsToTable \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--variant=</span><span class="hl ipl">${vcf}</span> <span class="hl str">\</span>
<span class="hl str">		--output=</span><span class="hl ipl">${vcf}</span><span class="hl str">.table.txt \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-F=CHROM -F=POS -F=MQ \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-F=QD -F=FS -F=MQRankSum -F=ReadPosRankSum \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--show-filtered</span>
<span class="hl str">	&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl opt">}</span>
</code>
</pre>
</div>
</div>

Based on the thresholds derived from the genotype metrics, the genotypes are first tagged and then filtered.
After this, the data is filtered for missingness and only bi-allelic SNPs are selected.

<a name="filterSNPS"></a>

<div class="kclass">

<div class="sourceCode">
<pre class="sourceCode">
<code class="sourceCode"><span class="hl slc">// git 1.14</span>
<span class="hl com">/* filter snps basaed on locus annotations, missingness</span>
<span class="hl com">   and type (bi-allelic only) */</span>
<span class="hl kwa">process</span> filterSNPs <span class="hl opt">{</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">label</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;L_78g10h_filter_Snps&#39;</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">publishDir</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;../../1_genotyping/3_gatk_filtered/&quot;</span><span class="hl opt">,</span> mode<span class="hl opt">:</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;symlink&#39;</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">input</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> vcf <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> tbi <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">from</span> raw_var_sites

	<span class="hl kwb">output</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;filterd_bi-allelic.vcf.gz&quot;</span> <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;filterd_bi-allelic.vcf.gz.tbi&quot;</span> <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">into</span> filtered_snps

	<span class="hl kwb">script</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl str">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl str">	gatk --java-options &quot;-Xmx75G&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		VariantFiltration \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-R=\$BASE_DIR/ressources/HP_genome_unmasked_01.fa \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-V</span> <span class="hl ipl">${vcf}</span> <span class="hl str">\</span>
<span class="hl str">		-O=intermediate.vcf.gz \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--filter-expression &quot;QD &lt; 2.5&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--filter-name &quot;filter_QD&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--filter-expression &quot;FS &gt; 25.0&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--filter-name &quot;filter_FS&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--filter-expression &quot;MQ &lt; 52.0 || MQ &gt; 65.0&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--filter-name &quot;filter_MQ&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--filter-expression &quot;MQRankSum &lt; -0.2 || MQRankSum &gt; 0.2&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--filter-name &quot;filter_MQRankSum&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--filter-expression &quot;ReadPosRankSum &lt; -2.0 || ReadPosRankSum &gt; 2.0 &quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--filter-name &quot;filter_ReadPosRankSum&quot;</span>
<span class="hl str"></span>
<span class="hl str">	gatk --java-options &quot;-Xmx75G&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		SelectVariants \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-R=\$BASE_DIR/ressources/HP_genome_unmasked_01.fa \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-V=intermediate.vcf.gz \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-O=intermediate.filterd.vcf.gz \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--exclude-filtered</span>
<span class="hl str"></span>
<span class="hl str">	vcftools \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--gzvcf intermediate.filterd.vcf.gz \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--max-missing-count 17 \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--max-alleles 2 \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--stdout  \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--recode | \</span>
<span class="hl str">		bgzip &gt; filterd_bi-allelic.vcf.gz</span>
<span class="hl str"></span>
<span class="hl str">	tabix -p vcf filterd_bi-allelic.vcf.gz</span>
<span class="hl str"></span>
<span class="hl str">	rm intermediate.*</span>
<span class="hl str">	&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl opt">}</span>
</code>
</pre>
</div>
</div>

At this point, the genotying is done.

### Phasing

To get from genotypes to haplotypes, we apply read-aware phasing using [**Shapeit**](https://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/genetics_software/shapeit/shapeit.html).
This takes the original sequencing reads into account, so in the first step the reads are screened for *Phase Informative Reads* (i.e. reads containing more than a single SNP).

This needs to be done for each LG independently, so we first need to split the genotypes before running `extractPIRs`.

<a name="phasing_start"></a>

<div class="kclass">

<div class="sourceCode">
<pre class="sourceCode">
<code class="sourceCode"><span class="hl slc">// git 1.15</span>
<span class="hl slc">// extract phase informative reads from</span>
<span class="hl slc">// alignments and SNPs</span>
<span class="hl kwa">process</span> extractPirs <span class="hl opt">{</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">label</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;L_78g10h_extract_pirs&#39;</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">input</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwc">val</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> lg <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">from</span> LG_ids2
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> <span class="hl kwc">val</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> sample <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">val</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> sample_lane <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl kwb">input</span> <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> index <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">from</span> pir_bams.collect<span class="hl opt">()</span>
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> vcf <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> tbi <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">from</span> filtered_snps

	<span class="hl kwb">output</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> <span class="hl kwc">val</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> lg <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;filterd_bi-allelic.LG</span><span class="hl ipl">${lg}</span><span class="hl str">.vcf.gz&quot;</span> <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;filterd_bi-allelic.LG</span><span class="hl ipl">${lg}</span><span class="hl str">.vcf.gz.tbi&quot;</span> <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;PIRsList-LG</span><span class="hl ipl">${lg}</span><span class="hl str">.txt&quot;</span> <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">into</span> pirs_lg

	<span class="hl kwb">script</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl str">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl str">	LG=&quot;LG</span><span class="hl ipl">${lg}</span><span class="hl str">&quot;</span>
<span class="hl str">	awk -v OFS=&#39;</span><span class="hl esc">\t</span><span class="hl str">&#39; -v dir=\$PWD -v lg=\$LG &#39;{print \$1,dir&quot;/&quot;\$2,lg}&#39; \$BASE_DIR/metadata/bamlist_proto.txt &gt; bamlist.txt</span>
<span class="hl str"></span>
<span class="hl str">	vcftools \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--gzvcf</span> <span class="hl ipl">${vcf}</span> <span class="hl str">\</span>
<span class="hl str">		--chr \$LG \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--stdout \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--recode | \</span>
<span class="hl str">		bgzip &gt; filterd_bi-allelic.LG</span><span class="hl ipl">${lg}</span><span class="hl str">.vcf.gz</span>
<span class="hl str"></span>
<span class="hl str">	tabix -p vcf filterd_bi-allelic.LG</span><span class="hl ipl">${lg}</span><span class="hl str">.vcf.gz</span>
<span class="hl str"></span>
<span class="hl str">	extractPIRs \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--bam bamlist.txt \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--vcf filterd_bi-allelic.LG</span><span class="hl ipl">${lg}</span><span class="hl str">.vcf.gz \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--out PIRsList-LG</span><span class="hl ipl">${lg}</span><span class="hl str">.txt \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--base-quality 20 \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--read-quality 15</span>
<span class="hl str">	&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl opt">}</span>
</code>
</pre>
</div>
</div>

Using those PIRs, we can then proceed with the actual phasing.
The resulting haplotypes are converted back into `.vcf` format.

<div class="kclass">

<div class="sourceCode">
<pre class="sourceCode">
<code class="sourceCode"><span class="hl slc">// git 1.16</span>
<span class="hl slc">// run the actual phasing</span>
<span class="hl kwa">process</span> run_shapeit <span class="hl opt">{</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">label</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;L_75g24h8t_run_shapeit&#39;</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">input</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> <span class="hl kwc">val</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> lg <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> vcf <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> tbi <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> pirs <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">from</span> pirs_lg

	<span class="hl kwb">output</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;phased-LG</span><span class="hl ipl">${lg}</span><span class="hl str">.vcf.gz&quot;</span> <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">into</span> phased_lgs

	<span class="hl kwb">script</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl str">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl str">	LG=&quot;LG</span><span class="hl ipl">${lg}</span><span class="hl str">&quot;</span>
<span class="hl str"></span>
<span class="hl str">	shapeit \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-assemble \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--input-vcf</span> <span class="hl ipl">${vcf}</span> <span class="hl str">\</span>
<span class="hl str">		--input-pir</span> <span class="hl ipl">${pirs}</span> <span class="hl str">\</span>
<span class="hl str">		--thread 8 \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-O phased-LG</span><span class="hl ipl">${lg}</span>
<span class="hl str"></span>
<span class="hl str">	shapeit \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-convert \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--input-hap phased-LG</span><span class="hl ipl">${lg}</span> <span class="hl str">\</span>
<span class="hl str">		--output-vcf phased-LG</span><span class="hl ipl">${lg}</span><span class="hl str">.vcf</span>
<span class="hl str"></span>
<span class="hl str">	bgzip phased-LG</span><span class="hl ipl">${lg}</span><span class="hl str">.vcf</span>
<span class="hl str">	&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl opt">}</span>
</code>
</pre>
</div>
</div>

After the phasing, we merge the LGs back together to get a single data set.
We export a comple data set as well as one that was filtered for a minor allele count of at least two.

<div class="kclass">

<div class="sourceCode">
<pre class="sourceCode">
<code class="sourceCode"><span class="hl slc">// git 1.17</span>
<span class="hl slc">// merge the phased LGs back together.</span>
<span class="hl slc">// the resulting vcf file represents</span>
<span class="hl slc">// the &#39;SNPs only&#39; data set</span>
<span class="hl kwa">process</span> merge_phased <span class="hl opt">{</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">label</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;L_28g5h_merge_phased_vcf&#39;</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">publishDir</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;../../1_genotyping/4_phased/&quot;</span><span class="hl opt">,</span> mode<span class="hl opt">:</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;move&#39;</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">input</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> vcf <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">from</span> phased_lgs.collect<span class="hl opt">()</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">output</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;phased.vcf.gz&quot;</span> <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;phased.vcf.gz.tbi&quot;</span> <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">into</span> phased_vcf
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;phased_mac2.vcf.gz&quot;</span> <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;phased_mac2.vcf.gz.tbi&quot;</span> <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">into</span> phased_mac2_vcf

	<span class="hl kwb">script</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl str">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl str">	vcf-concat \</span>
<span class="hl str">		phased-LG* | \</span>
<span class="hl str">		grep -v ^\$ | \</span>
<span class="hl str">		tee phased.vcf | \</span>
<span class="hl str">		vcftools --vcf - --mac 2 --recode --stdout | \</span>
<span class="hl str">		bgzip &gt; phased_mac2.vcf.gz</span>
<span class="hl str"></span>
<span class="hl str">	bgzip phased.vcf</span>
<span class="hl str"></span>
<span class="hl str">	tabix -p vcf phased.vcf.gz</span>
<span class="hl str">	tabix -p vcf phased_mac2.vcf.gz</span>
<span class="hl str">	&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl opt">}</span>
</code>
</pre>
</div>
</div>

Finally, we are done with the entire genotyping procedure for the _SNPs olny_ data set.

---

### Indel masks

The `genotyping.nf` workflow contains an appendix that makes use of the genotyping likelihoods created in step git 1.10 to create an indel mask that is later used in the inference of the hamlet demographic history ([git 8.x](analysis-vi-demographic-history.html)).
(This part is excluded from the initial visualization of this script)

We restart by reopening the joint-sample genotype likelyhoods file and calling the indels from it.


<div class="sourceCode">
<pre class="sourceCode">
<code class="sourceCode"><span class="hl com">/* ========================================= */</span>
<span class="hl com">/* appendix: generate indel masks for msmc: */</span>

<span class="hl slc">// git 1.18</span>
<span class="hl slc">// reopen the gvcf file to also genotype indels</span>
<span class="hl kwa">process</span> joint_genotype_indel <span class="hl opt">{</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">label</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;L_O88g90h_genotype_indel&#39;</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">publishDir</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;../../1_genotyping/2_raw_vcfs/&quot;</span><span class="hl opt">,</span> mode<span class="hl opt">:</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;copy&#39;</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">input</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> vcf <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> tbi <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">from</span> gvcf_indel

	<span class="hl kwb">output</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;raw_var_indel.vcf.gz&quot;</span> <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;raw_var_indel.vcf.gz.tbi&quot;</span> <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">into</span> <span class="hl opt">(</span> raw_indel<span class="hl opt">,</span> raw_indel_to_metrics <span class="hl opt">)</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">script</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl str">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl str">	gatk --java-options &quot;-Xmx85g&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		GenotypeGVCFs \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-R=\$REF_GENOME \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-V=</span><span class="hl ipl">${vcf}</span> <span class="hl str">\</span>
<span class="hl str">		-O=intermediate.vcf.gz</span>
<span class="hl str"></span>
<span class="hl str">	gatk --java-options &quot;-Xmx85G&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		SelectVariants \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-R=\$REF_GENOME \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-V=intermediate.vcf.gz \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--select-type-to-include=INDEL \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-O=raw_var_indel.vcf.gz</span>
<span class="hl str"></span>
<span class="hl str">	rm intermediate.*</span>
<span class="hl str">	&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl opt">}</span>
</code>
</pre>
</div>

We export the the indel genotype metrics to determine cutoff values for the hard filtering step.


<div class="sourceCode">
<pre class="sourceCode">
<code class="sourceCode"><span class="hl slc">// git 1.19</span>
<span class="hl slc">// export indel metrics for filtering</span>
<span class="hl kwa">process</span> indel_metrics <span class="hl opt">{</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">label</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;L_28g5h_genotype_metrics&#39;</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">publishDir</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;../../1_genotyping/2_raw_vcfs/&quot;</span><span class="hl opt">,</span> mode<span class="hl opt">:</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;copy&#39;</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">input</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> vcf <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> tbi <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">from</span> raw_indel_to_metrics

	<span class="hl kwb">output</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;</span><span class="hl ipl">${vcf}</span><span class="hl str">.table.txt&quot;</span> <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">into</span> raw_indel_metrics

	<span class="hl kwb">script</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl str">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl str">	gatk --java-options &quot;-Xmx25G&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		VariantsToTable \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--variant=</span><span class="hl ipl">${vcf}</span> <span class="hl str">\</span>
<span class="hl str">		--output=</span><span class="hl ipl">${vcf}</span><span class="hl str">.table.txt \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-F=CHROM -F=POS -F=MQ \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-F=QD -F=FS -F=MQRankSum -F=ReadPosRankSum \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--show-filtered</span>
<span class="hl str">	&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl opt">}</span>
</code>
</pre>
</div>

Based on the exported metrics the genotypes are being filtered.


<div class="sourceCode">
<pre class="sourceCode">
<code class="sourceCode"><span class="hl slc">// git 1.20</span>
<span class="hl slc">// hard filter indels and create mask</span>
<span class="hl kwa">process</span> filterIndels <span class="hl opt">{</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">label</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;L_78g10h_filter_indels&#39;</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">publishDir</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;../../1_genotyping/3_gatk_filtered/&quot;</span><span class="hl opt">,</span> mode<span class="hl opt">:</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;copy&#39;</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">input</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> vcf <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> tbi <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">from</span> raw_indel

	<span class="hl kwb">output</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;filterd.indel.vcf.gz&quot;</span> <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;filterd.indel.vcf.gz.tbi&quot;</span> <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">into</span> filtered_indel
	<span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;indel_mask.bed.gz&quot;</span> <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">into</span> indel_mask_ch

	<span class="hl com">/* FILTER THRESHOLDS NEED TO BE UPDATED */</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">script</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl str">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl str">	gatk --java-options &quot;-Xmx75G&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		VariantFiltration \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-R=\$REF_GENOME \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-V</span> <span class="hl ipl">${vcf}</span> <span class="hl str">\</span>
<span class="hl str">		-O=intermediate.vcf.gz \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--filter-expression &quot;QD &lt; 2.5&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--filter-name &quot;filter_QD&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--filter-expression &quot;FS &gt; 25.0&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--filter-name &quot;filter_FS&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--filter-expression &quot;MQ &lt; 52.0 || MQ &gt; 65.0&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--filter-name &quot;filter_MQ&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--filter-expression &quot;SOR &gt; 3.0&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--filter-name &quot;filter_SOR&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--filter-expression &quot;InbreedingCoeff &lt; -0.25&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--filter-name &quot;filter_InbreedingCoeff&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--filter-expression &quot;MQRankSum &lt; -0.2 || MQRankSum &gt; 0.2&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--filter-name &quot;filter_MQRankSum&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--filter-expression &quot;ReadPosRankSum &lt; -2.0 || ReadPosRankSum &gt; 2.0 &quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--filter-name &quot;filter_ReadPosRankSum&quot;</span>
<span class="hl str"></span>
<span class="hl str">	gatk --java-options &quot;-Xmx75G&quot; \</span>
<span class="hl str">		SelectVariants \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-R=\$REF_GENOME \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-V=intermediate.vcf.gz \</span>
<span class="hl str">		-O=filterd.indel.vcf.gz \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--exclude-filtered</span>
<span class="hl str"></span>
<span class="hl str">	zcat filterd.indel.vcf.gz | \</span>
<span class="hl str">		awk &#39;! /</span><span class="hl esc">\\</span><span class="hl str">#/&#39; | \</span>
<span class="hl str">		awk &#39;{if(length(\$4) &gt; length(\$5)) print \$1&quot;</span><span class="hl esc">\\</span><span class="hl str">t&quot;(\$2-6)&quot;</span><span class="hl esc">\\</span><span class="hl str">t&quot;(\$2+length(\$4)+4);  else print \$1&quot;</span><span class="hl esc">\\</span><span class="hl str">t&quot;(\$2-6)&quot;</span><span class="hl esc">\\</span><span class="hl str">t&quot;(\$2+length(\$5)+4)}&#39; | \</span>
<span class="hl str">		gzip -c &gt; indel_mask.bed.gz</span>
<span class="hl str"></span>
<span class="hl str">	rm intermediate.*</span>
<span class="hl str">	&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl opt">}</span>
</code>
</pre>
</div>

Since we need one indel mask per linkage group, we create a channel of LGs.


<div class="sourceCode">
<pre class="sourceCode">
<code class="sourceCode"><span class="hl slc">// git 1.21</span>
<span class="hl com">/* create channel of linkage groups */</span>
<span class="hl kwa">Channel</span>
	.from<span class="hl opt">( (</span><span class="hl str">&#39;01&#39;</span>..<span class="hl str">&#39;09&#39;</span><span class="hl opt">) + (</span><span class="hl str">&#39;10&#39;</span>..<span class="hl str">&#39;19&#39;</span><span class="hl opt">) + (</span><span class="hl str">&#39;20&#39;</span>..<span class="hl str">&#39;24&#39;</span><span class="hl opt">) )</span>
	.map<span class="hl opt">{</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;LG&quot;</span> <span class="hl opt">+</span> it <span class="hl opt">}</span>
	.into<span class="hl opt">{</span> lg_ch <span class="hl opt">}</span>
</code>
</pre>
</div>

The linkage group channel is combined with the filtered indels.


<div class="sourceCode">
<pre class="sourceCode">
<code class="sourceCode"><span class="hl slc">// git 1.22</span>
<span class="hl slc">// attach linkage groups to indel masks</span>
lg_ch.combine<span class="hl opt">(</span> filtered_indel <span class="hl opt">)</span>.set<span class="hl opt">{</span> filtered_indel_lg <span class="hl opt">}</span>
</code>
</pre>
</div>

Finally, one mask per linkage group is created from the indel positions.


<div class="sourceCode">
<pre class="sourceCode">
<code class="sourceCode"><span class="hl slc">// git 1.23</span>
<span class="hl slc">// split indel mask by linkage group</span>
<span class="hl kwa">process</span> split_indel_mask <span class="hl opt">{</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">label</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;L_loc_split_indel_mask&#39;</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">publishDir</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;../../ressources/indel_masks/&quot;</span><span class="hl opt">,</span> mode<span class="hl opt">:</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;copy&#39;</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">input</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> <span class="hl kwc">val</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> lg <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> bed <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">from</span> filtered_indel_lg

	<span class="hl kwb">output</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> <span class="hl kwc">val</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> lg <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;indel_mask.</span><span class="hl ipl">${lg}</span><span class="hl str">.bed.gz &quot;</span> <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">into</span> lg_indel_mask

	<span class="hl kwb">script</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl str">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl str">		gzip -cd</span> <span class="hl ipl">${bed}</span> <span class="hl str">| \</span>
<span class="hl str">		grep</span> <span class="hl ipl">${lg}</span> <span class="hl str">| \</span>
<span class="hl str">		gzip -c &gt; indel_mask.</span><span class="hl ipl">${lg}</span><span class="hl str">.bed.gz</span>
<span class="hl str">	&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl opt">}</span>
</code>
</pre>
</div>
</div>

All indel masks are exported to the resources folder within the root directory.
